metadata.title: CVE-2024-53985 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: rails-html-sanitizer is responsible for sanitizing HTML fragments in Railsapplications. There is a possible XSS vulnerability with certainconfigurations of Rails::HTML::Sanitizer 1.6.0 when used with Rails >=7.1.0 and Nokogiri < 1.15.7, or 1.16.x < 1.16.8. The XSS vulnerability withcertain configurations of Rails::HTML::Sanitizer may allow an attacker toinject content if HTML5 sanitization is enabled and the applicationdeveloper has overridden the sanitizer's allowed tags with both "math" and"style" elements or both both "svg" and "style" elements. Thisvulnerability is fixed in 1.6.1.

criterions.comment: ruby-rails-html-sanitizer package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
